entries.title: Samsung Beats IBM, Apple, Intel, Google For 2022 Patent Crown; 56% Of U.S. Patents Go To Foreign Firms
entries.description: 56% of all patent grants were to foreign companies, a fact the IFI refers to as “stunning.” American companies earned 142,703 patents, more than three times the next national competitor ...

entries.title: Apple’s Massive MacBook Pro Failure
entries.description: It’s not a great time to be buying a MacBook Pro, with delays, questions of performance, and leaked technology all challenging consumers. What has happened to Tim Cook’s flagship laptop?

entries.title: China’s AI Implementation Is Edging Ahead Of The US
entries.description: As Kaifu Lee, a keen observer of AI development in China has put it, “we're now in the age of AI implementation.”

entries.title: Tonga Marks The First Anniversary Of The Devastating Hunga Eruption And Tsunami
entries.description: A year on from the Hunga eruption, the Pacific island nation hopes to set up monitoring systems to watch other submarine volcanoes.

entries.title: Pfizer Covid-19 Bivalent Vaccine And Stroke Risk: What You Need To Know
entries.description: There’s been a lot of chatter about the January 13 announcement from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) about a possible “safety signal” for the Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 bivalent booster vaccine.

entries.title: Tested By A Teacher: Three Refillable Multifunction Inkjet Printers For Every Budget
entries.description: Start 2023 off right with these multifunction printers from HP, Canon, and Epson.

entries.title: Robbie Knievel Dies After Pancreatic Cancer Battle, Yet Anti-Vaxxers Blame Covid-19 Vaccines
entries.description: Daredevil stunt performer Robbie Knievel died on early Friday morning at the age of 60.

entries.title: Will Naughty Dog’s Next Game Be ‘The Last Of Us Part 3’?
entries.description: We are one day away from the premiere of The Last of Us on HBO, which is about to be released with some of the best reviews for a freshman season of any show on that channel.

entries.title: Why The Racial Wealth Gap Hasn’t Shrunk Since MLK’s Death: A Look At The Numbers
entries.description: But in states like California, Maryland, Texas and Georgia, the Black middle-class has begun to encroach on the white middle-class.

entries.title: MSI Launches First Gaming Headset, With Clear Voice Capture Using ENC
entries.description: Keen gamers will appreciate the MSi Immerse HG40 ENC headset which is the first MSi gaming headset to feature an environmental noise canceling (ENC) algorithm.

entries.title: Google Is Handling Stadia’s Death Better Than Its Life
entries.description: Say what you will about Google Stadia’s ill-fated run as a streaming service, but Google is handling its death very well.

entries.title: Time To Play ‘Guess Which Show Netflix Cancelled After Season 1 Now’?
entries.description: Netflix has cancelled yet another series after its first season.

entries.title: ‘Destiny 2’ And The Case Of The Disappearing Characters
entries.description: Something a bit…weird and unsettling is happening with Destiny 2 right now, and while I don’t want to spark some sort of mass panic, it does seem like it’s worth addressing.

entries.title: ‘Velma’ Is So Bad It's Spawned Psyop Conspiracy Theories
entries.description: People are certainly talking about Velma, that much is true. Just…not very positively. Velma currently has the lowest audience score I’ve seen for an HBO or HBO Max production, a 7%. To get that low requires not just “review bombing” but your show also likely has to be…genuinely bad.

entries.title: Eat Bugs! It’s What’s For Dinner
entries.description: Farming edible insects to feed people and livestock could help improve food security and support developing economies and potentially replace conventional animal feed

entries.title: Climate Change Could Worsen The Dangers Of Pediatric Diarrhea In The Global South
entries.description: According to a recent study published in the journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, the increased frequency of droughts and heavy rainfall is linked to an increase in the rates of diarrheal disease among children under the age of 3 years.

entries.title: CES 2023: Automakers Beware, Cars Are Technology Products Now
entries.description: The Consumer Electronics Show has become a major launchpad for new automotive technology, because the market has changed and cars are gadgets like smartphones and new computing devices.

entries.title: New Apple Leak Increases iPhone 15 Price Shock
entries.description: You are going to pay more for iPhone 15 upgrades...

entries.title: Apple Confirms More Problems For iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Pro Buyers
entries.description: Apple confirms another iPhone 14 Pro, iPhone 14 Pro Max problem...

entries.title: Current Climate: Greener Gas Plants, Glass Onion’s Hydrogen Goof And The High Cost Of Disasters
entries.description: This week’s Current Climate, which every Saturday brings you the latest news about the business of sustainability.

entries.title: The Coming Democratization Of Financial Services, Thanks To Artificial Intelligence
entries.description: AI is successfully reducing financial service costs and accessibility for those who have been left out or had limited access to traditional banking options.

entries.title: Smarter Railroad Tracks Are Boosting Train Safety And Efficiency
entries.description: Train- and rail equipment maker Alstom says it’s installing new-generation digital circuits that send data through rails to help operators better track and maintain the movement of freight and passengers.

entries.title: Turn An Old Phone Into A Brilliant Handheld Xbox
entries.description: Find out how to convert an old smartphone into a cheap handheld games console that can play hundreds of AAA games

entries.description: How to solve today's Wordle.

entries.description: Here's today's 'Heardle' song, along with some hints.

entries.title: Today’s ‘Quordle’ Answers And Clues For Saturday, January 14
entries.description: Some hints and the solution for today's 'Quordle' are just ahead.

entries.title: The Top 10 Most Exciting Space Missions To Watch In 2023, Ranked
entries.description: 2023 will see our Moon, the moons of Jupiter, Venus and bizarre asteroids be explored as well as some landmark test flights and exciting one-off missions by NASA, SpaceX and others.
